item.title: The Fast Fourier Transform Algorithm
item.description: Overview1 The Discrete Fourier Transform (DFT), when computed naively following its mathematical definition, has a time complexity of $\mathcal{O}(N^{2})$. However, by using the algorithm described below, the time complexity can be reduced to $\mathcal{O}(N\log_{2}N)$. This efficient computation method of the Discrete Fourier Transform is known as the Fast Fourier Transform (FFT).
